algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) with graph optimization using value-based grouping
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum steps to reach the last index from the first, with jumps to adjacent or same-value indices.
problem_summary_technical: BFS on an implicit graph, optimizing by grouping indices with the same value to reduce redundant exploration.
key_insights: This is a shortest path problem on an unweighted graph, making BFS ideal.
Grouping indices by value significantly optimizes the search by allowing jumps to multiple same-value indices efficiently.
Clearing the group after processing prevents re-adding the same value-based jumps, ensuring O(n) complexity.
